com.netflix.fenzo

Interface VirtualMachineCurrentState


  • public interface VirtualMachineCurrentState
    Represents the current state of the host (virtual machine) that Fenzo is considering for a task assignment. A fitness calculator plugin may use the information from this state object to influence how it optimizes task placement decisions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VirtualMachineLease getCurrAvailableResources()
      Returns a VM lease object representing totals of resources from all available leases on this host for the current scheduling run.
      java.lang.String getHostname()
      Get the name of the host on which the virtual machine is running.
      java.util.Collection<TaskRequest> getRunningTasks()
      Get a list of those tasks that had already been assigned to this host before the current scheduling run started.
      java.util.Collection<TaskAssignmentResult> getTasksCurrentlyAssigned()
      Get list of task assignment results for this host so far in the current scheduling run.

    • Method Detail

      • getHostname

        java.lang.String getHostname()
        Get the name of the host on which the virtual machine is running.
        Returns:
        the hostname

      • getCurrAvailableResources

        VirtualMachineLease getCurrAvailableResources()
        Returns a VM lease object representing totals of resources from all available leases on this host for the current scheduling run.
        Returns:
        a lease object that represents resources that are currently available on the host

      • getTasksCurrentlyAssigned

        java.util.Collection<TaskAssignmentResult> getTasksCurrentlyAssigned()
        Get list of task assignment results for this host so far in the current scheduling run.
        Returns:
        a collection of tasks that the current scheduling iteration assigned to this host but that are not launched/executing yet

      • getRunningTasks

        java.util.Collection<TaskRequest> getRunningTasks()
        Get a list of those tasks that had already been assigned to this host before the current scheduling run started.
        Returns:
        a collection of the tasks running on this host
